timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should just require Javadoc to be built with Java 8 instead?
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -25,6 +25,20 @@ task aggregateJavadoc(type: Javadoc) {
   source subprojects.javadoc.source
   destinationDir project.rootProject.file("site/docs/javadoc/${getJavadocVersion()}")
   classpath = project.rootProject.files(subprojects.javadoc.classpath)
+
+  final JAVADOC_FIX_SEARCH_STR = '\n\n' +
+          'getURLPrefix = function(ui) {\n' +
+          '    return \'\';\n' +
+          '};\n'
+
+  doLast {
+    // Fix bug with search
+    if (JavaVersion.current() >= JavaVersion.VERSION_11) {

replies.bodyText: The search is actually very nice addition, we can remove this fix and fix each time manually
replies.author: guykhazma

replies.bodyText: Oh, the search is only available with Java 11? Then that's a nice reason to keep it as you have it here.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: the search was added starting with Java 9 (as part of the move to HTML 5), it became default in Java 10 (see here)
replies.author: guykhazma

timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -99,6 +99,8 @@ Available operations to update a table are:
 
 ### Transactions
 
+`Table` also enables to commit multiple table operations at once.

replies.bodyText: thanks for the suggestion. updated accordingly.
replies.author: guykhazma
